revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2015}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2010}} {{Infobox person |name = Jeff Davis |image = Jeff Davis 2010.jpg |image_size = 180px |caption = Davis in 2010 |birth_name = Jeffrey Bryan Davis |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|10|6}} |birth_place = [[Los Angeles, California]], U.S. |occupation = Actor, comedian, singer |years_active = 1984–present }} '''Jeffrey Bryan Davis''' (born October 6, 1973),{{cite web|url=http://www.oocities.org/whosewebsite/jeffbio.html|title=Jeff Davis biodata|accessdate=April 25, 2013|work= Whose Website Is It Anyway?}} is an [[Americans|American]] actor, comedian, and singer. He is known for his work as a recurring performer on the [[improvisational comedy|improv comedy]] show ''[[Whose Line Is It Anyway? (U.S. TV series)|Whose Line Is It Anyway?]]'' Since July 2016 he has starred as the Goblin Hero Boneweevil on the (formerly) [[Seeso]] original production [[HarmonQuest]]. He appeared in ''[[Drew Carey's Green Screen Show]]'' as one of the main actors. In 2011, Davis appeared on Drew Carey's improv show, ''[[Drew Carey's Improv-A-Ganza|Improv-A-Ganza]]''. He is also known for his impersonations of several actors, notably [[Christopher Walken]], [[Keanu Reeves]], and [[Jeff Goldblum]]. ==Background== Davis was born in Los Angeles and raised in [[Whittier, California]]. He began his acting career at the age of four at the [[Groundlings]] Theater in Hollywood, playing Linus in ''[[You're A Good Man, Charlie Brown]]''. He attended [[La Serna High School]]. Davis started in commercials, and at age 11 was cast as Louis in the Broadway production of ''[[The King and I]]'' with [[Yul Brynner]]. A national U.S. tour followed and, after 750 performances, Davis returned home to attend school.{{cite web|url=http://luvinlife2010.tripod.com/id1.html|title=Biography|accessdate=April 25, 2013|work= Chronicles of Jeff Davis}} ==Career== {{BLP sources section|date=December 2016}} Davis's screen acting debut was a dramatic role on the series ''[[Highway To Heaven]]'' as a 12-year-old college student prodigy. He began performing with various [[Improvisational theatre|improv troupes]]. He worked with the short video website [[Channel 101]].com and was in the [[Dan Harmon]] series ''Laser Fart''. In addition, he played the role of [[David Lee Roth]] of [[Van Halen]] in an episode of ''[[Yacht Rock (web series)|Yacht Rock]]''. Soon after, he landed a recurring role on the improv series ''[[Whose Line Is It Anyway? (U.S. TV series)|Whose Line Is It Anyway?]]''. His comedic timing won over comedian [[Steve Martin]] and the other producers of ''[[The Downer Channel]]'', earning Davis a spot in the cast of the comedy series in 2001. He has appeared in the television series ''[[The Norm Show]]'', ''[[The Drew Carey Show]]'' and ''[[The Jamie Kennedy Experiment]]''. He appeared in the acclaimed telefilm ''[[Tuesdays With Morrie]]'' and was a series regular in ''[[Happy Family (2003 TV series)|Happy Family]]'', opposite [[Christine Baranski]] and [[John Larroquette]], in the fall of 2003. He played the role of an attorney in the October 9, 2008 episode of ''[[The Sarah Silverman Program]]''. Davis regularly appears as a guest on the ''[[Superego (podcast)|Superego]]'' podcast, where he has impersonated [[Sam Elliott]]. Davis has toured on "The Improv All Stars" alongside fellow ''Whose Line'' stars [[Drew Carey]], [[Ryan Stiles]], [[Colin Mochrie]], [[Chip Esten]], [[Brad Sherwood]], [[Kathy Greenwood]] and [[Greg Proops]]. Davis has been part of two [[USO]] tours and tours with Stiles, Esten and Proops doing live shows in various cities across the U.S. and Canada. He was often used in games that required improvisational singing and usually partnered with [[Wayne Brady]] on ''Whose Line'' and Esten on ''Drew Carey's Green Screen Show'' or live tours. Davis was one of the rotating announcers on television's longest running game show, ''[[The Price Is Right (U.S. game show)|The Price Is Right]]'', after [[Rich Fields]]'s departure, until [[George Gray (TV host)|George Gray]] was chosen as the next permanent announcer.{{cite web|url=http://gameshows.about.com/b/2010/07/22/sherwood-davis-auditioning-for-price-is-right-announcer.htm|title=Sherwood, Davis Auditioning for Price is Right Announcer|accessdate=April 25, 2013|work=About.com}} Since June 2012, Davis has co-hosted the live improvisational comedy podcast ''[[Harmontown]]'' with ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'' creator [[Dan Harmon]], started within Meltdown Comics in Los Angeles. It's now being done at the Typewriter Thearter. Davis acts as "[[comptroller]]", serving as the show's anchor, announcer and sidekick{{cite web|url=http://podbay.fm/show/542228532 |title= Listen to Episodes of Harmontown on Podbay |accessdate=February 19, 2016}} In 2014, [[Game Show Network]] announced he would host a game show called ''The Line''. He is often confused with [[Jeff Davis (writer)|Jeff Davis]], the creator of the television series ''[[Teen Wolf (2011 TV series)|Teen Wolf]]''.{{cite web|url=http://harmontown.com/podcast/97|title= Episode 97 of the Harmontown podcast|accessdate=September 29, 2014|work=Harmontown}} ==Filmography== ===Television=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !
